docs.lead_paragraph: The ''West Wing'' company was in Washington last week, filming around the capital. Aaron Sorkin, the show's producer and writer, dropped by the New York Times bureau for lunch.
docs.abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column on Hillary Clinton's campaigning with little mention of man named Bill or her first ladydom; says Mrs Clinton's resume as 'yuppie lawyer' is not as impressive as she thinks it is, since sitting next to Marian Wright Edelman does not entitle someone to seat in Senate (M),

byline.original: By SUSANNA RODELL  It's been a frustrating experience for me watching the debate about health care in this country. I lived in Australia for 10 years, and I keep wanting to shout at all the learned committees and task forces and study groups: Hey! Look at Australia!   The Times and many health experts have argued strongly for managed competition, reorganizing the private sector so that market forces would help keep costs under control. But this consumer believes Australia offers a better way. It's not just that they do it well there; I also think their system might transfer to the U.S

docs.lead_paragraph: Aired Monday night on NBC: There's a rumor that if Barack Obama is elected president, he might appoint Bill Clinton to the Supreme Court. Yeah, which is good because the one woman Hillary doesn't mind Bill hanging out with is Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tomorrow in Chappaqua, Hillary Rodham Clinton will meet with Ned Lamont, the Greenwich businessman who aspires to join her in the Senate. We're told they will talk about ways she can be helpful to Mr. Lamont's campaign to unseat Senator Joseph I. Lieberman. Will she raise money for him, campaign by his side (as her husband did for Mr. Lieberman during the primary) or maybe just offer political savvy? Tomorrow will tell.
docs.abstract: Senator Hillary Clinton will meet with Ned Lamont to discuss how she can help his senate campaign.
docs.snippet: Senator Hillary Clinton will meet with Ned Lamont to discuss how she can help his senate campaign....
